attributes.action: dismiss Peter Hain as a consequence of gross misconduct
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Peter Hain, Secretary of State for Work And Pensions, is guilty of gross misconduct in failing to properly declare donations and loans received by him as required by the law and Parliamentary procedures.

It is not a defence to declare ignorance of the facts or fault of an employee.  It is his duty to ensure that his office complies fully with the law. Such excuses would not stand examination in disciplinary or legal proceedings in a commercial environment and the Prime Minister should not be prepared to accept such excuses from an experienced and senior cabinet minister.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
